author: PaulHigin
body:
The ISE is designed for editing, running, debugging script files.  But many scripts run as script blocks that have no script source files.  In this case the ISE provides a poor command line debugger compared to the PowerShell console.  

1.  The ISE command line debugging should be as good as PowerShell console.
2.  The ISE could create temporary files for running script blocks so that they could be debugged in the ISE GUI similar to how script files are currently debugged.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: Work on the ISE is on hold and instead effort is being put into VSCode.  The latest PowerShell plugin for VSCode now supports debugging script blocks.  So this issue can be closed.

title: Update PowerShell ISE to better handle debugging script blocks
